case_title: INAYATULLAH CHAUDHRY and others vs AZAD JAMMU AND KASHMIR GOVERNMENT through its Chief Secretary and others
court: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondant: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Government through its Chief Secretary
complaint_summary: The appellants challenged the seniority determination of Assistant Engineers, particularly Sardar Muhammad Ashraf Khan, alleging irregularities in appointments and promotions.
investigation_summary: The seniority determination was reviewed by the Secretary Works and the President of Azad Jammu and Kashmir. Objections were raised regarding ad hoc appointments and Public Service Commission approvals.
judgment_summary: The appeals of Inayatullah Chaudhry and Muhammad Ilyas Khan were accepted, modifying the seniority list. The appeal of Iqbal Ratyal was dismissed due to procedural issues and lack of merit.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeals accepted partially; seniority list modified.
legal_arguments: Rule 8 of Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servants Rules 1977 regarding seniority determination.
Section 9 of Public Service Commission Ordinance regarding ad hoc appointments.
Art. 24, K.S.R. Vol. II regarding seniority determination.
statutes: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servants Rules 1977

witness_statement.Muhammad Ashraf: Provided evidence regarding his continuous service in the Electricity Department.
witness_statement.Ali Muhammad: Testified about the communication of orders.
witness_statement.Sheikh Ghulam Muhammad: Denied receipt of spare copies of the order in Chief Engineer's office.

key_issues: Determination of seniority based on ad hoc appointments.
Applicability of Public Service Commission approvals.
Procedural irregularities in communication of orders.

maxims.Ratio Decidendi: The court avoided unnecessary determination of issues not essential for the case.

legal_terms.Seniority: Order of precedence among employees based on service rules.

words_and_phrases.Merit list: Ranking of candidates based on qualifications and performance.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the seniority determination of Assistant Engineers in Azad Jammu and Kashmir. The appellants challenged the government orders citing irregularities in ad hoc appointments and Public Service Commission approvals. The court partially accepted the appeals, modifying the seniority list while dismissing one appeal due to procedural issues.
